cross_plane_en.description: enable Gr/Gb cross processing in bilateral filtering

radial_anchor_tab.description: anchor tables from center to frame boundary

bpc_fmax.description: upper offset factor used in single bpc applied to center pixel

bpc_fmin.description: lower offset factor used in single bpc applied to center pixel

bpc_maxshft.description: upper offset (as right-shifting) used in single bpc applied to neighbor pixels

bpc_minshft.description: lower offset (as right-shifting) used in single bpc applied to neighbor pixels

bpc_offset.description: common absolute offset value used in single bpc applied to both center pixel and neighboring pixel

blk_pix_matching_rb.description: R and B channel block matching or pixel matching selection. Value 0 means block matching in determining filter coefficient. Value 4 means pixel matching
blk_pix_matching_rb.additional_notes: may use 4 for ultra low light cases

blk_pix_matching_g.description: Gr and Gb channel block matching or pixel matching selection. Value 0 means block matching in determining filter coefficient. Value 4 means pixel matching
blk_pix_matching_g.additional_notes: may use 4 for ultra low light cases

distance_ker_tab.description: bit shifting value corresponding to distance weight; [0][] - R/B, [1][] - Gr/Gb
distance_ker_tab.additional_notes: non-zero value n means left shift (n-1); zero value means weight of 0. Range 0: 1-4, 1: 1-2, 2: 1-2

curve_offset_tab.description: offset that is subtracted from normalized difference before generating bilateral coefficients

noise_prsv_anchor_lo.description: anchor point below which noise_preserve will be noise_prsv_lo
noise_prsv_anchor_lo.additional_notes: Range of 0 to 1023 corresponds to intensity level 0 to 1023

noise_prsv_anchor_hi.description: anchor point above which noise_preserve will be a flat maximum value
noise_prsv_anchor_hi.additional_notes: Range of 0 to 1023 corresponds to intensity level 0 to 1023

noise_prsv_lo_tab.description: minimum value for noise preserve, [0] - R/B, [1] - Gr/Gb

noise_prsv_hi_tab.description: maximum value for noise preserve, [0] - R/B, [1] - Gr/Gb

radial_gain_tab.description: base value for each anchor, [0][] for loc_fac0, [1][] for loc_fac1

edge_softness.description: control bilateral filter strength together with noise_std_lut
